item.title: Next Blox Fruits Update: Everything You Need To Know
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're looking for information on the next Blox Fruits update, you have come to the right place. One of Roblox’s most popular and most entertaining games, Blox Fruits is a seafaring adventure that pulls inspiration from the iconic anime franchise One Piece.

Since launching in 2019, this swashbuckling experience has remained at the top of the charts and received a steady stream of updates to refine and improve the title. With such a large and fervent playerbase, there’s little surprise that the demand for updates is huge.

So, for those of you out there who have already scoured the many seas and are looking for more content to find and loot to plunder, we’re detailing all the information available on the next Blox Fruits update. You can find all the details below:

When is the next Blox Fruits update coming?

There is currently no official release date for Blox Fruits Update 29. However, given the previous cadence of releases and fan speculation, many are assuming it will drop in either late January or early February of 2026.

When was the last Blox Fruits update?

The last major update for Blox Fruits was Update 28, otherwise known as The Tiger Update. This update added the Tiger fruit (formerly the Leopard), introduced the Werewolf Blox Fruit mutation, and the Trick or Treating event.

Blox Fruits update patch notes

Below are all of the patch notes for Blox Fruit Update 28: The Tiger Update

Increased Max Level Capacity: 2750-2800

Reworked Blox Fruit:

  • Tiger (formerly Leopard)

New Blox Fruit mutation:

  • Werewolf

New Event

  • Trick Or Treating
  • The First, Second annd Third Seas are decorated for Halloween.
  • Mygame43's bunker has been added to the Cafe.

New Accessories:

  • Pumpkin Mask
  • Coven Witch Hat

New NPCS

  • Witch
  • Halloween Gacha Dealer

New Boss

  • Rip_Return

New Boss Raid

  • Unbound Werewolf

New potions

  • Disguise Elixir
  • Suspicious Growth Potion
  • Big Head Elixir
  • Pumpkin Potion
  • Lava Bomb Elixir
  • Monster Mash Elixir
  • Candy Concoction

New Currency

  • Candy Corn

New Fish

  • Jack-O-Fish
  • Jester Clownfish
  • Zombie Bass
  • Vampire Squid
  • Terrorbones

New Sunken Chests

  • Fall Chest
  • Halloween Chest

New Player Profile Backgrounds

  • Full Moon
  • Halloween Tapestry

Changes

  • The Titles Specialist interface has been redesigned.

Tiger + Werewolf

  • M1: Transformed and awakened hits now break Observation.
  • Z: The final projectile breaks the Observation, has a larger area of effect and hitbox. The awakened final blow has a longer range.
  • X: Now breaks Observation (both on the ground and in the air).
  • C: Improved Hitboxes for Grabbing and Punching.
  • F: While awake, the user no longer takes damage when using the move against enemies.
  • Improved Werewolf: Defeating an enemy while awake will now fully restore the user's health

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/next-blox-fruits-update-everything-you-need-to-know/1100-6536040/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Roblox Blox Fruits Stock And Restock Times
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you are an ardent Blox Fruits player, the ocean-faring Roblox experience that has taken the world by storm, then you will want to keep a keen eye on the many stock options scattered around the Blox Fruits seas. Those titular fruits are the keys to success, but not only are some rarer than others, but vendors constantly change their wares, so we’re here to explain everything you need to know about the Blox Fruits stock as well as restock times.

What is the Blox Fruits Stock System?

The most important part of Blox Fruit is, unsurprisingly, those titular Blox Fruits. If you want to expand your collection, you will need to amass some money through regular gameplay and then head to a vendor to buy Blox Fruit.

Sadly, not all of the Blox Fruit are available at once, and their appearance is dictated by their rarity. So, you’re much more likely to see common Blox Fruit than you are rare ones. Anyone wanting to expand their abilities or collect all of the Blox Fruit will need to routinely visit the in-game vendors with the hopes of eventually finding and purchasing every Blox Fruit in the game. Regular vendors have at least three Blox Fruit, while the Advanced Fruit Dealer on Mirage Island holds five.

How often do Blox Fruits stocks refresh?

The regular Blox Fruit stocks offered by Normal dealers change every four hours. Meanwhile, the Advanced dealers change their stock every two hours instead.

When do Blox Fruits stocks refresh?

The Blox Fruits vendors' stock refreshes at a set time depending on your region. So, every four hours, or at one of the times listed below:

Timezone1st Restock2nd Restock3rd Restock4th Restock5th Restock6th Restock
Pacific Time12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PM
Mountain Time1 AM5 AM9 AM1 PM5 PM9 PM
Central Time2 AM6 AM10 AM2 PM6 PM10 PM
Eastern Time3 AM7 AM11 AM3 PM7 PM11 PM
Atlantic Time12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PM
BST (UK TIME)12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PM

How do I know what Blox Fruits will be stocked?

There is no way to find out ahead of time which Blox Fruits will be stocked by the Normal Dealer or the Advanced Dealer. However, you can use third-party websites and apps to see exactly which Blox Fruits are in stock at the current moment in time.

How to check Blox Fruit stock in-game

If you want to check the Roblox Blox Fruit stock, you will have to find and interact with any of the many dealers within the game. If you are looking for a particular fruit, or just want to make checking stock easier, you can save next to a dealer and then respawn next to them, to save yourself a journey.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/roblox-blox-fruits-stock-and-restock-times/1100-6536033/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Ubisoft Posts Strong First-Half Growth And Teases Major Creative Shake-Up Coming In 2026
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After a short delay, Ubisoft has posted its first-half earnings figures for 2025-2026. The company says that its Q2 net bookings exceeded expectations and its deal with Tencent to invest $1.2 billion in Vantage Studios--a new subsidiary focused on its three main franchises--is expected to close within a few days.

Ubisoft says that its Q2 net bookings were up 39% year-on-year, driven by stronger-than-expected performance across its games catalogue and TV projects. The company had initially predicted that it would reach $520 million for its quarterly books, but this figure increased to $566.7 million.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Assassin's Creed Shadows: Claws of Awaji Launch Trailer

"Our portfolio showed contrasting dynamics this quarter, with softer trends for Rainbow Six Siege, reflecting a phase of evolution for the game in an intense FPS environment, offset by strong performances across the rest of the catalog. The Assassin’s Creed franchise exceeded our expectations, confirming its positive momentum and ability to engage players over time. The Division 2 also continued to perform strongly, benefiting from the momentum of the Battle for Brooklyn DLC," Ubisoft Yves Guillemot said in a press release.

The formation of a new operating model built around "Creative Houses" is still on track, and Ubisoft says that these will foster "stronger creative vision, greater focus, efficiency, autonomy and accountability" as it aims to finalize these plans by the end of the year. A full reveal of the new operating model will be unveiled in January 2026.

Looking ahead, Ubisoft is expecting its net bookings to remain stable year-on-year and it has forecast third-quarter net bookings of $352 million. After the initial date for Ubisoft's financial report was delayed, it was speculated that the company might have found a private buyer, similar to how EA sold itself to Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners, and the private equity firm Silver Lake.

CFO Frederick Duguet told staff in an internal email that the reason for the delay was so that Ubisoft could take "extra time to finalize the closing of the semester" and limit such "unnecessary" speculation. Ubisoft has gone through a turbulent time as of late, as the company reportedly canceled a Civil War-inspired Assassin's Creed game and Assassin's Creed creative lead Marc-Alexis Côté left Ubisoft in October. In the earnings report shared in July 2025, the company noted that revenues had continued to decline at the time.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Snag A Black Friday Deal On Just Dance 2026 Limited Edition
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

You can get Just Dance 2026 Limited Edition on the Nintendo Switchfor just $30 (was $50) as part of Amazon's Black Friday discounts. While this deal is for the boxed copy of the game, note that it's a download code instead of a cartridge. Nevertheless, this is still a great deal on the game for those who are interested. For more on the best video game and hardware deals, check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals hub for seasonal savings on video games, anime, hardware, and much more.

Just Dance 2026 Limited Edition

$30 (was $50)

While this is technically a physical version with a game box you can display on your shelf, the game itself is not included on a cartridge. Instead, you'll get a download code for the full game, so you'll have to make sure you have plenty of room on your Switch. With that said, this is still the Limited Edition of the game, which comes with the Dr. Gigavolt pack. This allows you to customize your Dancer card and scoring effects with items pulled from Party Mode.

The Just Dance series has seen yearly entries since the original launched in 2009. Since then, we've had countless annual releases, spin-offs, and updates on pretty much every console available (there's even a VR version). Just Dance 2026 is the latest, having just released on October 14, making this new low price even more valuable. This version features popular songs from modern artists such as Sabrina Carpenter, Doechii, Tate McRae, Chappell Roan, and many more. You also get 1 month of free access to Just Dance+, which allows you to dance to songs from Just Dance 2023 and later, along with any other Music Packs you may already have on the subscription service.

Just Dance 2026 features two new modes you can try out. There's the co-op Party Mode, where up to six players can dance through a series of fun scenarios in Dr. Gigavolt's Lab. The Just Dance+ inclusions are compatible with this mode. Then there's Camera Controller Mode, which was beta tested for the 2025 edition of the game. This allows players to turn their smartphones into a camera that connects to the game, helping to track dance moves and improve precision. And of course, the classic Workout, Challenge, and Local Co-Op modes make their return.
